data.text: @billboard Wasn't her dad. It was Michael Jackson a radio show host. Idiots.
@billboard It wasn't her dad. She explained it you fools. It was some radio personality by the name Michael Jackson whose star she cleaned. NOT MICHAEL JACKSON her dad. Dimwits.
@billboard it wuZnT HeR daDs sTaR https://t.co/LBEFyYQrwG
@billboard @LadyMJFAM It wasn't her dad it was a radio talk show host named Michael Jackson. 😊
@billboard Billboard will mislead people just for click bait. The star belong to a different michael jackson. I cant stand y'all. So desperate and dishonest.
@billboard 👩‍🚒

@billboard @RaniaAniftos It wasn't her Dad's star! She literally said it in her tweet that you've referenced. How are you all "news" when you get it so wrong that your readers have to correct you? Please report accurately.

@rickydigital @EstefiFraire @billboard We're also talking about a defendant's right to a fair trial being violated by having a civil case brought forward before the criminal case. The accuser's family admitted in a book they wrote that Jackson wanted the criminal case dealt with first and they didn't. https://t.co/Z1YU4nQpZG

@rickydigital @EstefiFraire @billboard Some reasons specific to Jackson were:

•Having a civil case come before a criminal case violates a defendant’s right to a fair trial. 

•Civil lawsuits take time: 3-4 years isn’t unusual. 

•Jackson had completed rehab for a Demerol addiction which could have resurfaced.

@rickydigital @EstefiFraire @billboard I'm not because I understand that civil lawsuits are complex and that Jackson had satisfactory reasons for settling the two cases. Some general reasons as to why cases are settled:

https://t.co/Qlw3CxWEAl
@billboard It was a different star
